pros: Good pay and progression in a booming field
cons: Bad work life balance but nice work friends

pros: Friendly people Creative space Flexible rewarding fun
cons: Lack of proper communication at times The environment can go from really slow to busy almost instantly Sometimes I was the only individual helping everyone on the floor and it was stressful. I was expecting better training However this is perfect for anyone looking for an introduction to technology and likes helping others with technological needs

pros: Everything about this place is awesome. Great culture and very forward thinking org
cons: Starting pay isn’t great but there’s a lot of room for promotions

job_title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) in Kansas City, KS
pros: Lots of growth opportunity, good mission and great stewardship. Good benefits.

pros: Very good company with service oriented with good pay
cons: Have Good Gentle Balanced Leadership

review_title: Great mission, good work environment, but not great for innovators
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kansas City, KS
pros: The international work of the organization is incredible and awe-inspiring. Free, humble/simple lunch every day. Great work/life balance. PTO allotment is extremely generous (4+ weeks for starting employees!)
cons:
Pay is low (thought benefits -- pto, health insurance, free lunch, 401k match does make up for low base salary). 
Innovations take years to implement. There's a lot of bureaucracy and red tape, which to some extent is good... but it's overkill here. Hard for folks that like to innovate, try new things, experiment to feel the freedom to do so. 
Silos between departments. Unbound's working on this, but there's still a lack of respect/clarity between departments about what everyone should be working on and a sense of oneness about the focus of the organization.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kansas City, MO
pros: Friendly atmosphere to work in, everyone in the office is there to make a true impact - you can feel good about what you do each day. Generally accepting of all employees and their differences, especially because it is a Christian based company.
cons: The non-profit atmosphere forces people to walk on egg shells around others so that everyone feels included and heard - this causes projects to move very slowly. Also, the Re-brand has caused an identity crisis and it is showing in the publications and language used. A organization like this needs to have a strong identity in order to speak to donors.

pros: 403b match they match your contribution
cons: Manager lacks experience. I was employed for two months before I was even trained. I basically read child letters all day for days at a time. Supervisors are unapproachable and and are unavailable most days. Employees and assistant manager positions are more informed and experienced than the actual managers. Issues brought to attention of managers are not followed up on but corrective actions is always quickly executed without giving proper training to employees. In my experience with my manager, i feel he was very spiteful. I was there for over two years and it never improved. Rather than offer me support as my superior, I felt like he just wanted to point out what I was doing wrong and make sure other superiors saw it.

pros: Mission of the organization is amazing. Great benefits!
cons: Extensive micromanagement. There are three department managers who heavily rely on team leads to be available to employees 24/7. Training needs improvements/revamping. Enforcement of new policies that require employees to use PTO for arriving to work 30 seconds late. There is all of energy an focus that is going into breathing down employees necks all day. So much so that the retention rate in this department is very bad.

review_title: Unbound is an amazing place to work.
pros:
Opportunity to advance/move IF positions become available. They like to hire/promote from within. 
Free lunch
Paid Holidays
Generous 401k and amazing benefits (dental and health 90% paid for)
Seriously fun people 
The knowledge that you are doing something bigger than yourself. :)
Considering the way the economy is I would say that the pay is about right for the work that one does here. Starting pay of $13/hour for most entry level positions.
cons: Raises all depend on sponsors generosity in that year. If the year does not see growth, a raise is not likely.

pros: There are some dedicated people there who do want to do good (but they are inevitably discouraged by their coworkers who don't really work.) You get free lunch, they close over the Easter holiday, you can often not work and get away with it.
cons: There's a standard set that most employees just don't work. It seems that anyone with actual drive decided to go to Unbound to start their early retirement and just coast.  A lot of people in leadership positions who aren't qualified to be. You can't take any issues to upper management because nothing will be done.

review_title: This company was an absolute joy to work for.
job_title: Web Designer in Kansas City, KS
pros:
• Company is doing great work for a great cause
• They were very caring and flexible during a rough period in my life. 
• The people are all genuine and love the work that they do. 
• Company makes up for lower salary (bc they are a nonprofit) with lunch provided everyday, great benefits and 401k and great vacation.
cons: Salary a bit low, but it's a nonprofit so it's understandable.

review_title: Good if you find the right team
job_title: Translation Coordinator in Kansas City, KS
pros: Strong culture which they're continuously trying to improve.  The company has a great mission and truly do a good job of putting the money where it needs to be. The benefits are great.
cons: Some the teams could have better management. I have seen employees be miserable in one team, but then move to another and thrive.  However, positions becoming available in your dream team can be hard to come to. The wages could be better.

pros: Lunch everyday, CEO really cares about the people working there, you feel like you are really helping others, weekly & encouraging team meetings

pros: Amazing cause and effective approach. Humble, committed staff. Excellent benefits.
cons: Opportunities for advancement don't come around often since people rarely leave.

review_title: Once you loose the mission view, get a better job.
pros: If you believe in the mission, it feels good to work here.
cons: Pay significantly under market value. Computer and technology is old. Upper management is in chaos. Culture is forced and superficial.

job_title: Communication Liaison in Kansas City, KS
pros: Lunch is served daily, and you meet some great people
cons: Management doesn't listen to employers, there is a lot of negativity in the building, lots of people feeling they're better than you in every aspect. The CEO only talks to the people he likes/knows and doesn't even bother getting to know anyone else.

pros: Coworkers are the best, pay is decent for a non-profit. Good community.
cons: Problems get ignored, causing more issues.
